results.title: A Matter of life and death
results.creator_credit: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Archers Film Productions and Independent Producers
results.brief_description: Squadron Leader Peter Carter (David Niven), is caught between two worlds, reality, and the other which exists in his imagination that has been contaminated by war. As his plane travels over the English Channel in a ball of fire, he prepares to jump without a parachute. In what he believes are his final moments he shares his feelings on love and poetry with an American WAC, Kim Hunter. After he lands ashore he meets the WAC and they fall in love. All seems well, but a case of concussion causes Carter to experience hallucinations in which he finds himself on trial within his imaginary world. This film also features Raymond Massey, Roger Livesey and Richard Attenbourough. Also known as “Stairway to heaven”. Earthbound sequences are filmed in technicolour and Heaven sequences in black and white.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Archers Film Productions and Independent Producers

results.title: The Players
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Gil Brealey, James de B. Domville, Tom Daly, National Film Board of Canada and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A backstage view of what it means to be a player in a celebrated theater company. Here is Canada’s Stratford Company, with an all-star cast headed by William Hutt, on tour in Australia. It is a friendly, unaffected observation of what goes into a play, both on stage and behind the scenes, at rehearsals and informal social gatherings. Filmed at the Opera House in Sydney and the Festival Theatre in Adelaide, it provides a rare, behind-the-scene glimpse into the lives and times of the people in a professional theatre company. Director of photography: Ron Lowe.

results.title: Assault on Precinct 13
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, J Kaplan and CKK Corporation
results.brief_description: In John Carpenter’s low-budget classic, the skeleton crew of a ghetto police station fights off a horde of street thugs who are seeking revenge against a locked-up prisoner. It’s a ‘Rio Bravo’ for the lawless modern age; once the siege starts, the screen appears to explode in bullets and flying glass. The action is so raw it doesn’t seem choreographed, so fast it doesn’t seem plausible.

results.title: Bhaji on the beach
results.creator_credit: Gurinder Chadha, Nadine Marsh-Edwards and Umbi Films
results.brief_description: Life for 10 Anglo-Indian women from the industrial city of Birmingham is about to take a decidedly interesting turn. They’ve set off on a bus trip to the seaside resort of Blackpool for a “female fun time”. With a mixed bag of ages, attitudes and social classes, it’s going to be nothing short of outrageous when these ladies leave behind the demands of spoiled husbands, children and lovers to encounter a world full of strippers, seducers and several other british unmentionables!

results.title: A French woman = Une femme Francaise
results.creator_credit: Regis Wargnier, Volker Schlondorff, Yves Marmion and UGC Images
results.brief_description: A French Woman ambitiously recreates the historical settings of an unhappy love affair against the backdrop of France’s colonial wars (and subsequent defeats). Jeanne ( Emmanuelle Beart) marries Louis (Daniel Auteuil), a soldier who is soon called to combat in World War II, the first of his long absences for military duty. Feeling suffocated when her husband is away, Jeanne has adulterous affairs. No matter how public her infidelities, Louis always takes her back so that the family life (and bourgeois order) with their children can resume before his next far-off posting. Jeanne’s longest affair is with Mathias (Gabriel Barylli), whom she meets when her husband is stationed in postwar Berlin; Mathias follows her to France. Beart’s intense performance as a woman whose life is dominated by her romantic passions vividly shows the pain of an often unsympathetic and self-obsesessed character. Wargnier’s film is reminiscent of the Douglas Sirk melodramas of the 50’s. In French with English sub-titles.

results.title: Scream
results.creator_credit: Wes Craven, Cary Woods, Cathy Konrad and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell) is a teenager struggling through life with a boyfriend (Skeet Ulrich) not content with their present sex life, a father who is constantly absent on business trips, and the approaching one year anniversary of her mother’s brutal murder. Just as things seem to be getting back to normal for Sidney and her friends, the small town of Woodsboro is once again plauged by a crazed killer who is turning the formula plot of horror movies into reality. Also starring David Arquette, Courteney Cox, Matthew Lillard and Rose McGowan.

results.title: James and the giant peach
results.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton, Allied Filmmakers and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Roald Dahl’s classic story, your whole family will delight in Disney’s juicy fantasy adventure, a wildly imaginative tale about a young boy who journeys to wondrous New York City to fulfill a dream. This is a magical odyssey soaring with amazing animation and original music. Cast includes Joanna Lumley, Simon Callow, Richard Dreyfuss, Pete Postlethwaite. Jane Leeves, Paul Terry, Miriam Margolyes, Susan Sarandon, David Thewlis.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Andy Paterson, Cary Brokaw, Sarah Ryan Black and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Restoration is a lavish costume drama which follows the story of Robert Merivel (Robert Downey Jr.)a young doctor whose life is changed when he is favoured by King Charles II (Sam Neill). Amidst the decadent opulance of the Restoration court Merivel soon loses sight of his career as a doctor but when he is abandoned by Charles he must return to poverty and find a place in the real world again. Based on the novel by Rose Tremain, Michael Hoffman’s film gives a great sense of life in England during the Restoration period. Sam Neill is excellent as the capricious King and Robert Downey Jr. likeable as the wayward Merivel. With appearances by Meg Ryan, Hugh Grant, Polly Walker, David Thewlis and Ian Mackellan and gorgeous music by Henry Purcell. Winner of 1996 Academy Awards for best Art Direction and Best Costume Design.

results.title: The Birdcage
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Armand (Robin Williams) and Albert (Nathan Lane) have created their own piece of serenity with their successful nightclub, “The Birdcage”. Armand takes care of the management and Albert performs nightly as the wonderful female impersonator, Starina. Their world is thrown into disarray when Armand’s son announces he is engaged to a conservative Senator’s daughter who is eager to meet their future son in laws parents. It will take all of Albert’s stage experience to convince the future in laws they are a ‘normal’ family. This reworking of the classic French farce ‘La Cage aux Folles’ will delight viewers with it sparkling humour and great performances by Robin Williams, Nathan Lane, Hank Azaria, Gene Hackman, Dianne Wiest, Dan Futterman and Calista Flockhart.

results.title: The Nightmare before Christmas
results.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This delightfully different animated fantasy opens the door to an intriguing new world - where extraordinary surprises and captivating music await. Journey on an incredible adventure of fantastic sights and sounds with the whimsical characters, Pumpkin Jack, Jack Skellington, and the rag doll, Sally. One day Jack discovers Christmastown - a glittering glory of bright lights and shiny packages. Charmed by its magic, Jack brings back this newfound holiday to his ghoulish friends, triggering an hilarious turn of events. Told through the innovative technique of stop-motion animation is an unparalleled adventure that dazzles the eye and charms the mind. Cast includes Danny Elfman, Chris Sarandon, Catherine O’Hara, William Hickey, Glenn Shadix.
